tournament.name: Tournament series Pauper #2 - Lega Pauper Cornaredo + Milano

decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to flood the board with aggressive creatures like Fungal Colossus and Refurbished Familiar, while also utilizing cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Fungal Colossus to generate value. Support cards such as Blood Fountain and Ichor Wellspring provide additional resources, while removal spells like Cast Down and Galvanic Blast help control the board. The deck also includes cards like Lembas and Nihil Spellbomb to maintain card advantage. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent through a combination of creature attacks and burn spells. Cards like Guttersnipe and Kessig Flamebreather can quickly chip away at the opponent's life total, while spells such as Lightning Bolt and Fireblast help finish them off. This deck aims to maintain a fast pace and constantly pressure the opponent, using efficient creatures and burn spells to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on using gates for mana fixing and control elements such as counterspells and removal. It includes a mix of creatures that can provide both defense and offense, along with card draw and protection cards to maintain board presence. The goal is to control the game by countering threats, removing key creatures, and utilizing the synergy between gates and spells to outlast the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and pump spells. By utilizing mana ramp from cards like Arbor Elf and Utopia Sprawl, the deck aims to play powerful threats like Nyxborn Hydra and Avenging Hunter ahead of schedule. Ram Through and Malevolent Rumble help to clear the way for attacks, while Writhing Chrysalis can provide a surprise blocker or additional threat. Overall, the deck seeks to maintain a fast-paced, high-pressure game plan to secure victory.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and sacrificing them for value. It utilizes cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Refurbished Familiar to generate tokens and trigger abilities when sacrificed. Cards like Ichor Wellspring and Nihil Spellbomb provide additional card advantage while Krark-Clan Shaman and Toxin Analysis can clear the opponent's board. Pulse of Murasa helps to bring back key creatures from the graveyard. The deck also includes removal spells like Cast Down and Cleansing Wildfire to control the board. Overall, the key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and synergistic sacrifice effects.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through a combination of creature attacks and burn spells. The creatures in the deck provide consistent damage output, while the burn spells and combat tricks allow for a burst of damage when needed. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent and finish them off before they have a chance to stabilize or gain control of the game. This deck aims to be fast and aggressive, pressuring the opponent to react quickly or risk losing the game.

This Mono Blue Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing cheap creatures like Cryptic Serpent and Delver of Secrets, while disrupting the opponent with counterspells like Counterspell and Dispel. The deck also includes card draw and deck manipulation cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency in drawing threats and answers. Additionally, cards like Tolarian Terror and Deem Inferior provide additional aggression and tempo advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with early threats and disruptive spells to win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells to control the opponent's plays while generating card advantage through self-mill effects. It aims to disrupt the opponent with counterspells and removal before closing out the game with powerful and difficult to deal with threats like Cryptic Serpent and Murmuring Mystic. The key strategy is to maintain control of the game through efficient use of resources and out-value the opponent by casting spells from the graveyard and creating tokens.

The deck revolves around utilizing the Balustrade Spy combo to quickly mill through the deck and put key creatures into the graveyard. By ramping up mana with defenders like Overgrown Battlement and Wall of Roots, the deck can generate massive amounts of mana to cast powerful spells such as Dread Return. The combo pieces work together to quickly set up a win condition, often overwhelming the opponent before they have a chance to react. The focus is on efficiently executing the combo while maintaining a solid board presence to protect against disruption.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and burn spells. With cards like Guttersnipe and Kessig Flamebreather, along with Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper, the deck aims to put continuous pressure on the opponent while burning them down to secure the win. The inclusion of cards like Sazacap's Brew and Highway Robbery provide additional ways to deal damage and close out the game swiftly. This deck prioritizes efficiency and speed in dealing damage to secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with creatures by using self-milling and sacrificing effects. Once the graveyard is stocked, it aims to bring back a powerful creature like Lotleth Giant or Molten Gatekeeper using cards like Dread Return. The deck also includes ways to generate extra mana to enable these combos. With a mix of reanimation spells and creature recursion, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big creatures early in the game.

This deck focuses on quickly getting creatures onto the battlefield while also taking advantage of artifacts. By using cards like Myr Enforcer and Refurbished Familiar, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. The inclusion of cards like Galvanic Blast and Reckoner's Bargain allow for direct damage to be dealt to the opponent, adding a control aspect to the deck. Additionally, the synergy between artifacts and spells like Thoughtcast helps to maintain card advantage throughout the game. The deck seeks to maintain a balance between aggression and card advantage to secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly flood the board with artifacts and use them to power up various spells and abilities, overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing cards that benefit from having a high number of artifacts in play, such as Myr Enforcer and Galvanic Blast, the deck aims to deal damage swiftly and efficiently. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Krark-Clan Shaman provides some utility and disruption against opponents' strategies. Overall, this deck focuses on being proactive and pressuring the opponent to secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using a combination of low-cost creatures and burn spells. By playing aggressive creatures like Guttersnipe and Voldaren Epicure alongside burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent and reduce their life total to zero as quickly as possible. Cards like Faithless Looting and Grab the Prize help to maintain card advantage while Highway Robbery can provide additional burst damage. The overall strategy is to be fast and relentless in dealing damage to win the game.

The main idea of this deck is to aggressively play low-cost creatures and utilize burn spells to quickly damage your opponent's life points. By using cards like Guttersnipe and Masked Meower to deal damage while also gaining value from cards like Sneaky Snacker and Voldaren Epicure, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with quick and efficient plays. With a focus on dealing damage both through creature attacks and direct burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast, this deck aims to secure victory before the opponent can mount a strong defense.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through the use of Urzatron lands to generate massive amounts of mana, along with various artifacts and spells to disrupt your opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Ashnod's Altar, Myr Retriever, and Myr Kinsmith, you can create a powerful artifact synergy while also controlling the board with spells like Malevolent Rumble and Nihil Spellbomb. The deck also includes ways to gain life and draw cards to outlast your opponent in a longer game.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressive creatures and then enchant them with powerful auras to make them even more threatening. By using cards like Ancestral Mask, Armadillo Cloak, and Ethereal Armor, the creatures become highly buffed and difficult for the opponent to deal with. The deck also includes some spells like Rancor and Ram Through to give additional support and removal options. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently while still maintaining a level of resilience with lifelink and protection spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently mill and cycle through the deck to find and play the combo pieces needed for a game-winning move. By using cards like Balustrade Spy to mill the library, and cards like Dread Return to bring back key creatures from the graveyard, the deck aims to set up a powerful combo involving Lotleth Giant and Sagu Wildling to deal massive damage to the opponent in a single turn. The deck also utilizes mana ramp and creature generation to ensure a smooth and successful execution of the combo.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to efficiently control the opponent's board through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while gradually building up its own resources and threats, such as Gurmag Angler and Tolarian Terror. By utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Thought Scour, this deck can manipulate its own library and maximize its draw power. Additionally, the deck has a solid mana base with lands like Ice Tunnel and Contaminated Aquifer to ensure smooth gameplay.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly swarm the board with Elves and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. By utilizing mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Priest of Titania, the deck can generate large amounts of mana to power out strong threats like Nyxborn Hydra and Timberwatch Elf. The deck also includes card draw spells like Lead the Stampede and Winding Way to help maintain a full hand of resources. Overall, the key strategy is to flood the board with Elves and use their synergies to push for a quick victory.

This deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with efficient and low-cost elf creatures to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. By utilizing mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Priest of Titania, the deck can quickly ramp up its mana production to play multiple threats each turn. Cards like Quirion Ranger and Timberwatch Elf provide additional support and buffs to the elf creatures, while Land Grant and Lead the Stampede help to ensure a consistent stream of threats. The deck aims to win the game through sheer numbers and aggressive early-game pressure.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing cards that allow for card advantage, such as Mulldrifter and Snap, while also utilizing Ephemerate to ensure value from key creatures like God-Pharaoh's Faithful and Murmuring Mystic. The deck also includes counterspells like Negate and Prohibit to protect its strategy. The inclusion of creatures like Sea Gate Oracle and Sunscape Familiar provide additional value and utility. The mana base is designed to support the deck's overall game plan and ensure consistency in casting spells.

This Pauper control deck focuses on utilizing "Gates" lands to fix mana and gain advantage through card draw. The deck includes removal spells like Journey to Nowhere and Prismatic Strands to control the board, while Counterspell and Spell Pierce offer protection. The creatures are resilient with Guardian of the Guildpact and Sacred Cat, while Squadron Hawk provides card advantage. The goal is to stall the game until the late game where Lrien Revealed can be cast to overwhelm the opponent.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and mana ramp spells. By utilizing cards like Arbor Elf, Utopia Sprawl, and Wild Growth, the deck aims to quickly build up its resources and cast powerful creatures such as Avenging Hunter and Sagu Wildling. Lead the Stampede helps refill the hand with even more creatures, while Malevolent Rumble provides a potential board wipe to clear the way for an aggressive onslaught. The deck's strategy revolves around fast, early aggression to put pressure on the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize sacrifice effects, artifact synergies, and removal spells to maintain board control and pressure the opponent with aggressive creatures. By combining cards like Refurbished Familiar, Fanatical Offering, and Galvanic Blast, along with the sacrifice outlets provided by cards like Krark-Clan Shaman and Writhing Chrysalis, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient threats and disruption. Additionally, the inclusion of Cleansing Wildfire and other land destruction effects can further disrupt the opponent's game plan and ensure the deck maintains tempo and advantage throughout the match.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and burn spells. The synergy between cards like Guttersnipe, Fiery Temper, and Lightning Bolt allows for a fast-paced gameplay style, while cards like Fireblast provide additional burst damage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of damage, utilizing cards like Highway Robbery to maintain card advantage. By efficiently utilizing resources and maximizing damage output, this deck aims to quickly take down the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using a combination of creatures with direct burn spells. By utilizing cards like Guttersnipe and Sneaky Snacker to chip away at the opponent's life total while also utilizing cards like Fiery Temper and Lightning Bolt for direct damage, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Fireblast and Highway Robbery provide additional burst damage potential to quickly end the game in your favor.

The focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using cheap aggressive creatures and burn spells. Guttersnipe, Kessig Flamebreather, and Sneaky Snacker provide early pressure while Voldaren Epicure helps maintain board presence. Fiery Temper, Fireblast, Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Grab the Prize are used as direct damage spells to finish off the opponent. Faithless Looting helps with card selection and Highway Robbery provides additional resource generation. With a high concentration of burn spells and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with efficient creatures and pump spells in order to deal damage as fast as possible. By utilizing cards like Arbor Elf and Utopia Sprawl to ramp up mana production, the deck can quickly cast powerful threats like Nyxborn Hydra and Bannerhide Krushok. Ram Through and Malevolent Rumble provide removal and combat tricks to help the creatures push through for lethal damage. The focus is on maintaining pressure and finishing the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing low-cost creatures and direct damage spells to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By constantly applying pressure with efficient and resilient threats, you aim to close out games before your opponent has a chance to stabilize. With a focus on speed and consistency, this deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver opposing strategies, punishing any slow or clunky plays with a relentless onslaught of damage.

The main concept of this deck is to create a powerful combo by utilizing walls that generate mana, such as Axebane Guardian and Overgrown Battlement, along with creatures that can untap them, like Quirion Ranger and Galvanic Alchemist. By combining these cards with Freed from the Real, the deck is able to generate infinite mana and potentially win the game in one turn. Lead the Stampede and Winding Way help to dig for combo pieces, while cards like Beastrider Vanguard and Valakut Invoker provide additional win conditions.

The deck focuses on creating a fast-paced, aggressive strategy by utilizing low-cost creatures and efficient combat tricks. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of weenie white creatures while utilizing cards like Guardians' Pledge and Battle Screech to pump up the team and push for damage. The deck also includes utility cards like Novice Inspector and Kor Skyfisher to generate card advantage and maintain tempo. With a focus on speed and synergy, this aggro weenie white deck aims to quickly build a wide board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.
